title: X-59 Model Tested in Japanese Supersonic Wind Tunnel
summary: Researchers from NASA and the Japanese Aerospace Exploration Agency (JAXA) recently tested a scale model of the X-59 experimental aircraft in a supersonic wind tunnel located in Chofu, Japan, to assess the noise audible underneath the aircraft.  The test was an important milestone for NASA’s one-of-a-kind X-59, which is designed to fly faster than the […]

title: NASA’s SpaceX Crew-11 to Support Health Studies for Deep Space Travel
summary: NASA’s SpaceX Crew-11 mission is set to launch a four-person crew to the International Space Station later this summer. Some of the crew have volunteered to participate in a series of experiments to address health challenges astronauts may face on deep space missions during NASA’s Artemis campaign and future human expeditions to Mars. The research […]

title: UK Government Commits £75.6M to Space Debris Removal Mission
summary:
The UK Space Agency has issued a £75.6 million (€87.3 million) call for proposals for what it describes as the nation’s first mission to actively remove defunct satellites from orbit. Announced on 3 July, the Active Debris Removal (ADR) mission will capture and deorbit two defunct UK-licensed satellites from low Earth orbit, where they will […]
The post UK Government Commits £75.6M to Space Debris Removal Mission appeared first on European Spaceflight.

title: Hubble Snaps Galaxy Cluster’s Portrait
summary: A massive, spacetime-warping cluster of galaxies is the setting of today’s NASA/ESA Hubble Space Telescope image. The galaxy cluster in question is Abell 209, located 2.8 billion light-years away in the constellation Cetus (the Whale). This Hubble image of Abell 209 shows more than a hundred galaxies, but there’s more to this cluster than even […]

title: Earth from Space: Lake District, UK
ESA Council receives Anniversary Statement
summary: The Council of the European Space Agency has received the Anniversary Statement as signed by Member States marking 50 years of the agency.

title: Curiosity Blog, Sols 4593-4594: Three Layers and a Lot of Structure at Volcán Peña Blanca
summary: Written by Susanne P. Schwenzer, Professor of Planetary Mineralogy at The Open University, UK Earth planning date: Monday, July 7, 2025 A few planning sols ago, we spotted a small ridge in the landscape ahead of us. Ridges and structures that are prominently raised above the landscape are our main target along this part of […]

title: Senate Appropriators Poised to Reject Proposed NASA Budget Cuts, But…
summary: The Senate Appropriations Committee met today to vote on three appropriations bills including the Commerce-Justice-Science bill that funds NASA. As presented by the CJS subcommittee, the bill would reject the […]

title: NASA Selects Instruments for Artemis Lunar Terrain Vehicle
summary: NASA has selected three instruments to travel to the Moon, with two planned for integration onto an LTV (Lunar Terrain Vehicle) and one for a future orbital opportunity. The LTV is part of NASA’s efforts to explore the lunar surface as part of the Artemis campaign and is the first crew-driven vehicle to operate on […]
